availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Executive Journal, 1859-1862

body.p:
27
The Governor appointed and commissioned the following Justices in Laurel county to wit: James Pastell and Saml Bayless in place of, Lemuel Casteel and Jonathan Price also P. G. Bryant in Distric No 6 in place of I. M. Johnson.

He issued a Proclamation calling for an extra session of the General Assembly to convene at the Capitol on the 17th day of January 1861, to take into consideration the interests of the Commonwealth as the same may be involved in or connected with the present distracted condition of the county at large

He issues a Proclamation ordering an election in the 33d Senatorial Distrcit composed of the counties of Montgomery, Clarke, Estill and Powell to supply the vacancy occasioned by the death of James McKee, late Senator.
Also a Proclamation ordering an election for Representative in the counties of Caldwell and Lyon made vacant by the resignation of W. B. Acree
He commissioned the following Major of Enrolled Militia, to wit: Lloyd Tilghman, Thomas Bristow and Wm H Miller.
